message: Take it or leave it, Bob. I'm feeling generous today.
You're not as generous as you thought, are you? Now it's my turn to make a better offer.
Let's be reasonable, Bob. I'm willing to give you a fair share, but I need the majority to make this worthwhile. Accept this and we can both walk away with something.
You're not willing to give me a fair share, so I'll take what I can get. But don't think you're getting off that easy!
I'm starting to think we're both being stubborn here. Let's compromise. I'll take a slightly smaller share, but I still need the majority to justify this.  This is my final offer.
You're not willing to budge, but I'm not going to give up yet. I'll take what I can get, but I'm not going to let you walk away with all the money!

Bob, I'm starting to get worried about this whole inflation thing. We need to reach an agreement before things get worse. I'm willing to take a smaller share, but I need a reasonable offer. Let's find a way to make this work.
You're starting to sound desperate, Alice. I'm not going to take pity on you. Make a better offer or walk away.
Bob, we're running out of time. Inflation is eating away at our potential earnings.  This offer is the best I can do to ensure we both get something. Accept this and let's avoid losing everything.
Fine, I'll meet you halfway. But don't think this is a sign of weakness. I'm just trying to salvage what's left.
